plugins.name: Design Rule Checker
plugins.description:
デザインシステムの一貫性を保つための自動チェックツールです。Figmaファイル内のデザイン要素を自動でスキャンし、設定されたデザインルールに違反している箇所を瞬時に検出します。


使い方

チェックしたい要素、または、ページを選択し「チェック開始」ボタンをクリック。

ルールに違反している要素の一覧が表示されたら、クリックして修正箇所を確認する。


主な機能

6つのチェック項目

  1. カラー: ライブラリ変数やスタイルが正しく適用されているかチェック
  2. フォント: 許可されたフォントファミリーとウェイトが使用されているかチェック
  3. 余白: 4pxグリッドに準拠した余白設定かチェック
  4. ボーダー: 適切なボーダー設定がされているかチェック
  5. サイズ: 4pxグリッドに準拠したサイズ設定かチェック
  6. レイアウト: オートレイアウトや制約が正しく設定されているかチェック


高度なフィルタリング機能

  1. 違反の種類別フィルタリング
  2. フレーム別フィルタリング
  3. レイヤー名での検索機能
  4. リアルタイムプレビュー
  5. カスタマイズ可能な設定
  6. 各チェック項目のON/OFF切り替え
  7. チェック対象ノードタイプの選択
  8. 非表示レイヤーの含む/含まない設定


使用シーン

  1. デザインシステムの品質管理
  2. チーム開発でのデザイン一貫性確保
  3. デザインレビュー前の事前チェック
  4. 新規メンバーのデザインルール教育


特徴

  1. 直感的なUI: ダークモード/ライトモード対応の美しいインターフェース
  2. 高速スキャン: 大量のレイヤーも素早くチェック
  3. 詳細な報告: 違反箇所をワンクリックでフォーカス
  4. 柔軟な設定: プロジェクトに合わせたカスタマイズが可能

デザインの品質向上とチームの生産性向上に貢献する、デザイナー必携のツールです。
plugins.tagline: デザインルール自動チェッカー

plugins.name: Corner Radius Balancer
plugins.description:
Corner Radius Balancer

Tired of manually calculating corner radius for nested elements in Auto Layout? 😩

This plugin helps you automatically balance the corner radius relationship between a parent frame and its child element, based on the simple formula: Parent Radius = Child Radius + Padding.


How it Works

The plugin simplifies your workflow by linking the three key values. When you adjust one, the others intelligently update:

Adjust Parent Radius

Padding remains fixed, and Child Radius updates automatically.

Adjust Padding

Parent Radius remains fixed, and Child Radius updates automatically.

Adjust Child Radius

Padding remains fixed, and Parent Radius updates automatically.


Key Features

Quick Fix Button ⚡

Instantly corrects the corner radius relationship with a single click.

Real-time Preview

See your changes on the canvas as you make them in the plugin.

Sync with Figma UI

Changes made directly in Figma's properties panel are reflected in the plugin.

Supports Various Corner Patterns

Works with uniform, partial, and custom corner radii by preserving the differences between them.


How to Use 📝

Select a Parent Frame

Choose a parent frame that uses Auto Layout and contains a child rectangle.

Adjust Values

Use the sliders or input fields in the plugin to adjust the values.

Complete

Click "Done" when finished.
plugins.tagline: Automatically adjust nested corner radius values.

plugins.name: Thumbly
plugins.description:
Thumbly — Instant Project Thumbnails

Create beautiful project thumbnails — fast and professional. This plugin helps you generate stunning thumbnail covers for your projects, presentations, and portfolio content directly in Figma.


No need to design covers from scratch. Just enter your title, description, pick an emoji, choose a theme — and Thumbly generates a ready-to-use thumbnail frame in seconds.


Key features:

  1. Instant thumbnail generation with custom text
  2. 100+ project-themed emojis to choose from
  3. Light and dark theme presets
  4. Optimized 1920×960px cover size
  5. Built-in Auto Layout for precise structure

accepted.name: Pavel Grachev
accepted.description: Product designer. Focused on clarity, usability, and quality design systems.

plugins.tagline: Effortless thumbnail design for every project.

137647.tagline: Effortless thumbnail design for every project.

plugins.name: Rename by text list
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you rename multiple layers in bulk using a text-based list.

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.
plugins.tagline: Rename one list of items by another list of text items

137516.name: Rename by text list
137516.description:

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.
137516.tagline: Rename one list of items by another list of text items

plugins.name: Select Similar Layers (Smart)
plugins.description:
Helps you quickly select layers that match your selection — based on either the layer name or, for text layers, their actual content. Unlike Figma’s built-in options, it works across Frames, groups, and deeply nested structures.


– Matches text layers by both name and text content

– Restricts search to the nearest shared parent (component, frame, or group)
plugins.tagline: Select all layers that match your selection by name and text content

140506.name: Select Similar Layers (Smart)
140506.description:
Helps you quickly select layers that match your selection — based on either the layer name or, for text layers, their actual content. Unlike Figma’s built-in options, it works across Frames, groups, and deeply nested structures.


– Matches text layers by both name and text content

– Restricts search to the nearest shared parent (component, frame, or group)
140506.tagline: Select all layers that match your selection by name and text content

plugins.name: SDS App Tokens Export
plugins.description:
The plugin exports colour variables as tokens for iOs and Android using a predefined format.


The plugin assumes that there are Core and Semantic collections of variables, and also checks if a variable refers to a variable from another library.


For example, the core collection contains variables like Blue/0, Pink/100, which are given a hex colour.


Semantic collection contains aliased variables of the form Brand/Primary: Pink/100. If a variable does not contain an alias reference, it is converted as a core token.


Using

The plugin gives you a choice of collection, Mode and colour scheme, which is contained in the first level of naming in Semantic collections.


Outputs

  1. for Core iOS: public static let Blue0 = Color(hex: "FFFFFFFFFFFFF")
  2. for Core Android: val Blue0: Color = Color(colour: 0xFFFFFFFFFF)
  3. for Semantic iOS: BrandTextPrimary: Color.DSColorPalette.Pink900
  4. for Semantic Android: BrandTextPrimary = DSCorePalette.Pink900
plugins.tagline: Export variables for mobile

138220.name: SDS App Tokens Export
138220.description:
The plugin exports colour variables as tokens for iOs and Android using a predefined format.


The plugin assumes that there are Core and Semantic collections of variables, and also checks if a variable refers to a variable from another library.


For example, the core collection contains variables like Blue/0, Pink/100, which are given a hex colour.


Semantic collection contains aliased variables of the form Brand/Primary: Pink/100. If a variable does not contain an alias reference, it is converted as a core token.


Using

The plugin gives you a choice of collection, Mode and colour scheme, which is contained in the first level of naming in Semantic collections.


Outputs

  1. for Core iOS: public static let Blue0 = Color(hex: "FFFFFFFFFFFFF")
  2. for Core Android: val Blue0: Color = Color(colour: 0xFFFFFFFFFF)
  3. for Semantic iOS: BrandTextPrimary: Color.DSColorPalette.Pink900
  4. for Semantic Android: BrandTextPrimary = DSCorePalette.Pink900
138220.release_notes: Small adjustments to the output for iOS. Variables are output in lower case.

plugins.name: Human Design Map Builder
plugins.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps inside Figma.

It reads structured data from a frame called INPUT_PANEL and dynamically updates the cover, highlights centers, colors gates, and reveals matching sections based on the data.

It ends by copying all relevant sections to a target page (מפות מעודכנות) for final output.

No data is sent to external services, except for a success/failure status posted to a webhook for internal workflow tracking.

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
plugins.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

137361.name: Human Design Map Builder
137361.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps inside Figma.

It reads structured data from a frame called INPUT_PANEL and dynamically updates the cover, highlights centers, colors gates, and reveals matching sections based on the data.

It ends by copying all relevant sections to a target page (מפות מעודכנות) for final output.

No data is sent to external services, except for a success/failure status posted to a webhook for internal workflow tracking.

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
137361.release_notes:
MAP BUILDER – Version 1.1
Release Notes

Added secure status reporting using dynamic tokens pulled directly from the design panel.

Improved user feedback with clearer notifications throughout the map-building process.

Minor bug fixes and internal stability enhancements.
137361.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

plugins.name: Update Human Design Panel
plugins.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps in Figma.

It retrieves JSON data from an external endpoint and populates predefined fields in a frame named INPUT_PANEL.

To function properly, the file must include that frame and the relevant text layers.

This plugin is intended for use within a specific workflow, but may be adapted for similar use cases.
plugins.tagline: Automatically fill a data panel in your Figma file from a remote JSON source.

137360.name: Update Human Design Panel
137360.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps in Figma.

It retrieves JSON data from an external endpoint and populates predefined fields in a frame named INPUT_PANEL.

To function properly, the file must include that frame and the relevant text layers.

This plugin is intended for use within a specific workflow, but may be adapted for similar use cases.
137360.release_notes:
PANEL UPDATER – Version 1.1
Release Notes

Improved security: now uses dynamic token authentication from the Figma panel to validate all server communications.

Enhanced error handling and status reporting to external services.

Minor adjustments for stability and performance.
137360.tagline: Automatically fill a data panel in your Figma file from a remote JSON source.

135634.release_notes:
✨ More Realistic Street Numbers
No more repetitive numbers! We've fixed the issue with too many double digits (like 22, 33, 44)
Expanded range - Addresses now include numbers in the hundreds (100+)
UK addresses improved with more authentic numbering patterns

🌟 Better Address Variety
More natural feel to generated addresses with varied number patterns
Added popular UK streets including Abbey Road, Oxford Street, and Baker Street
Smarter generation that creates more believable address combinations
135634.tagline: Toolkit for the Designers at Street!

plugins.name: Name Shame
plugins.description:
Name Shame is a lovingly vibe-coded plugin born from one designer’s deep-seated frustration with default layer names like “Rectangle 123” and “Group 87.” Instead of silently suffering, I decided to roast my own poor file hygiene—and now yours too.


This plugin scans your Figma file for default-named layers, serves up a spicy roast for each offender, and lets you rename them with beautifully ridiculous alternatives like “such_lazy” or “identity_crisis.” Use it for laughs, use it for cleanup, use it because your future self deserves better.


File hygiene matters. Might as well make it fun. 🎉

accepted.name: Aaron May
accepted.description:
Professional & Punchy
Creative Director with a love for design systems, clear UI, and a well-organized layer panel.

plugins.tagline: Scans bland layer names, dishes witty roasts and renames them with delightful absurdity

plugins.name: push-my-icons
plugins.description:
Push your Figma SVG icons to GitHub with ease.


This plugin helps you

  1. Automatically extract SVG nodes
  2. Upload them to your GitHub repository
  3. Generate a pull request with added/updated/removed icons


How to Use

  1. Open the plugin and fill in the following fields:
  2. GitHub personal access token
  3. GitHub repository URL
  4. Target folder path in the repo (e.g., src/icons)
  5. Pull request title and description
  6. Select all frames that contain your SVG icon components.
  7. Each selected frame should be a top-level container for one or more SVGs.
  8. Click "Push" button.
  9. The plugin will:
  10. Export all SVGs found in the selected frames
  11. Upload them to the specified folder in your GitHub repo
  12. Create a pull request containing added, updated, or deleted icon files
plugins.tagline: Push selected Figma icons to GitHub in one click.

plugins.name: Frames to Pages
plugins.description:
✨ About the Plugin


Organize your Figma files more efficiently!


This plugin moves each selected frame into its own new page automatically, helping you:


  1. Improve performance on heavy files.
  2. Make navigation faster and more intuitive.
  3. Keep versions and project sections clearly separated.


Perfect for large projects, collaborative teams, and anyone who values a clean and structured workspace.


💡 Why use this plugin?


As Figma projects grow, pages often become crowded with dozens (or hundreds) of frames.

This can cause:


  1. Slower loading times.
  2. Harder navigation and confusion for new collaborators.
  3. Increased risk of overwriting or losing important work.


By splitting frames into separate pages, your file becomes lighter, faster, and easier to maintain.


📚 Common Use Cases


  1. Large projects: Quickly organize dozens of screens into individual pages.


  1. Version management: Save different design versions separately without cluttering a single page.


  1. Developer handoff: Share organized sections with developers more easily.


  1. Team collaboration: Help new team members find what they need faster.


🛠️ How it works


  1. Select the frames you want to organize.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Choose whether to delete the original page or keep it.


Each selected frame will be placed into a brand new page, keeping its content intact.
plugins.tagline: Move each selected frame into its own new page automatically. Organize your Figma files easily.

plugins.name: AI Brand Guide
plugins.description:
AI Brand Guide transforms your design files into comprehensive, professional brand guides in seconds. Extract and organize design elements from your Figma files to create beautiful, developer-friendly documentation.


Key Features

  1. Intelligent Design Element Categorization: Automatically organizes your elements into Buttons, Icons, and Other Elements based on naming patterns
  2. Multi-Frame Export: Choose between Single Frame (all sections in one scrollable frame) or Separate Frames (each section in its own dedicated frame)
  3. Color Palette Extraction: Automatically extracts colors from your selection with detailed RGB, HEX, and HSL values
  4. AI-Powered Color Naming: Generate professional, creative names for your color palette with a single click
  5. Color Theory Generation: Create comprehensive color theory documentation including palette overview, color roles, visual qualities, and usage recommendations
  6. Typography Hierarchy System: Extracts and organizes typography into a structured system with Header and Paragraph classifications
  7. Component Documentation: Displays detailed specifications for buttons, icons and other elements including exact dimensions and padding values
  8. Visual Previews: Generates thumbnail previews for all design elements
  9. Form Element Detection: Special handling for contact forms and other form elements with improved display


How It Works

  1. Select your design elements in Figma (frames, components, or entire pages)
  2. Generate your brand guide with a single click
  3. Customize your guide: Rename colors, add color theory, or organize elements
  4. Export to Figma: Choose your preferred layout style and generate a complete brand guide directly in your Figma file


Element Categorization

For best results, use these naming patterns:

  1. Buttons: Include "btn" or "button" in the name (e.g., "btn-primary", "submit-button")
  2. Icons: Include "icn" or "icon" in the name (e.g., "icn-home", "arrow-icon")
  3. Other Elements: Include "element" or "other" in the name (e.g., "card-element", "other-banner")


What's Included in Your Brand Guide

  1. Color Palette: Complete color documentation with visual swatches and color codes
  2. Typography System: Organized type hierarchy with font details and visual examples
  3. Buttons Collection: All button variants with exact dimensions and padding specifications
  4. Icon Library: Organized icon set with dimensions and specifications
  5. Additional Elements: Cards, banners, forms and other UI components with detailed measurements
  6. Color Theory: Optional section providing insights on palette psychology, symbolism and usage


AI Brand Guide helps design teams maintain consistency while giving developers the exact specifications they need to implement designs accurately.
plugins.tagline: Transform designs into comprehensive brand guides with AI-powered color intelligence.

plugins.name: Layer Name To Text
plugins.description:
Instantly Add Layer Name Tags Beside Your Components

Tired of manually labeling component layers for documentation, presentations, or handoff?

Layer Name Labels is a simple yet powerful plugin that automates this process for you.


✅ What It Does

Layer Name Labels scans your selected component or frame and reads the names of visible layers. It then adds a text label next to each layer, mirroring its layer name—perfect for documentation, audits, teaching materials, or internal reviews.


💡 Why You'll Love It

⚡ One-click operation – Just select your components or frames and run the plugin.


🧠 Smart placement – Labels appear right next to each target layer.


✨ Non-destructive – Original design stays untouched. Labels are added as separate text layers.


🧩 Works with nested components – Recursively finds and labels layers inside complex structures.


🛠️ Perfect for:

Developer handoffs

Design system documentation

Training materials

Accessibility audits


🛠️ How It Works

Select any frame, group, or group of components.

Run the plugin.

Instantly see text layers added beside each target with its layer name.
plugins.tagline: Create names for countless layers in seconds

plugins.name: Component repeater
plugins.description:
# Component Repeater


A Figma plugin that helps you create components from repeated elements while preserving variations in styles, text, and images.


## What it does


This plugin analyzes your selection and creates a component that intelligently handles:


- Style variations (colors, effects, layout properties)

- Text content variations

- Image variations


When you have multiple similar elements that differ in styles or content, this plugin will:


1. Create a main component with variants for different styles

2. Create a separate component set for image variations

3. Replace all selected elements with instances of the component

4. Preserve the original text content and image placement


## How to use it


1. **Select similar elements**


- Select two or more groups or frames that have the same structure

- The plugin has a feature to help you find all similar elements from one selected node

- The elements can have different styles, text content, or images but should have the same layer structure


2. **Run the plugin**


- The plugin will analyze your selection and show variations in:

- Text content

- Colors and effects

- Images

- Layout properties


3. **Create the component**


- Click "Replace selection with a component"

- The plugin will create:

- A main component with style variants (if variations exist)

- A separate image component set (if images are used)

- Instances that preserve the original variations


4. **Finding similar elements**

- Select a single element

- Click "Find Similar Nodes" to select all elements with the same structure

- Use this to find more elements to include for replacement


## Tips


- The plugin works best with elements that have the same structure (same hierarchy of layers)

- Style variations are automatically detected and turned into variants

- Text content is preserved in each instance

- Images are turned into a swappable component

- Use the resize handle in the bottom right to adjust the plugin window size


## Requirements


- Works with groups and frames

- Selected elements must have the same layer structure

- Supports both direct images and image fills
plugins.tagline: Create components from repeated elements while preserving variations in styles, text, and images

111831.name: Component repeater

plugins.name: The Ultimate Table
plugins.description:
The Ultimate Table is a powerful Figma plugin that enables you to create reusable, fully customizable tables with draggable rows and columns.


Features

  1. Rearrange, remove, add, or duplicate columns and rows
  2. Drag to adjust column widths in header cells
  3. Automatic row height adjustment based on content
  4. Maintain linked tables across your design


Styling Options

  1. Customizable padding, margins, and borders
  2. Column text alignment controls
  3. Zebra striping support
  4. Header styling with sort/filter/search indicators
  5. Custom border radius
  6. Flexible font and size options


Smart Updates

  1. Master table controls for consistent styling


Need a quick start?

  1. Learn all there is to know in less than 10 minutes in this video tutorial
  2. Complete tutorial (Written & Video) at ultimate-table.com
plugins.tagline: Finally a plugin to create reusable, fully customizable tables with draggable rows and columns.
